info.title: Ingestion API
info.description:
The Ingestion API lets you connect third-party services and platforms with Algolia and schedule tasks to ingest your data.
The Ingestion API powers the no-code [data connectors](https://dashboard.algolia.com/connectors).

## Base URLs

The base URLs for requests to the Ingestion API are:

- `https://data.us.algolia.com`
- `https://data.eu.algolia.com`

Use the URL that matches your [analytics region](https://dashboard.algolia.com/account/infrastructure/analytics).

**All requests must use HTTPS.**

## Authentication

To authenticate your API requests, add these headers:

- `x-algolia-application-id`. Your Algolia application ID.
- `x-algolia-api-key`. An API key with the necessary permissions to make the request.
  The required access control list (ACL) to make a request is listed in each endpoint's reference.

You can find your application ID and API key in the [Algolia dashboard](https://dashboard.algolia.com/account/api-keys).

## Request format

Request bodies must be JSON objects.

## Response status and errors

Response bodies are JSON objects.

Successful responses return a `2xx` status. Client errors return a `4xx` status. Server errors are indicated by a `5xx` status.
Error responses have a `message` property with more information.

## Version

The current version of the Ingestion API is version 1, as indicated by the `/1/` in each endpoint's URL.

region.description: The region where your Algolia application is hosted.

tags.name: authentications
tags.description: Authentication resources describe how to connect to a source or destination.

tags.name: destinations
tags.description:
Destinations are Algolia products or features where your data should be used, such as a search index or events.
Algolia destinations require authentication with the `algolia` type.
You can reference authentications by their ID when creating destinations.

tags.name: observability
tags.description: Check the status and details of your task runs. A run is one instance of a configured task.

tags.name: sources
tags.description:
Sources are third-party platforms or services from where you want to ingest your data.
Sources may require authentication. To interact with such sources, you can reference an authentication resource by its ID.

tags.name: tasks
tags.description:
Tasks contain information how your data should be read from a source and stored in a destination.
Tasks have _triggers_ which determine when the task should run.

tags.name: transformations
tags.description: Transformations allows you to transform a record before it gets indexed in Algolia.

get.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API
get.description: This method lets you send requests to the Algolia REST API.

requestBody.description: Parameters to send with the custom request.

post.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API
post.description: This method lets you send requests to the Algolia REST API.

requestBody.description: Parameters to send with the custom request.

put.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API
put.description: This method lets you send requests to the Algolia REST API.

delete.summary: Send requests to the Algolia REST API
delete.description: This method lets you send requests to the Algolia REST API.

post.description:
Pushes records through the Pipeline, directly to an index. You can make the call synchronous by providing the `watch` parameter, for asynchronous calls, you can use the observability endpoints and/or debugger dashboard to see the status of your task.
If you want to leverage the [pre-indexing data transformation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/sending-and-managing-data/send-and-update-your-data/how-to/transform-your-data), this is the recommended way of ingesting your records.
This method is similar to `pushTask`, but requires an `indexName` instead of a `taskID`. If zero or many tasks are found, an error will be returned.

parameters.name: referenceIndexName
parameters.description: This is required when targeting an index that does not have a push connector setup (e.g. a tmp index), but you wish to attach another index's transformation to it (e.g. the source index name).

get.description: Retrieves a list of all authentication resources.

post.description: Creates a new authentication resource.
Searches for authentication resources.

get.description: Retrieves an authentication resource by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes an authentication resource. You can't delete authentication resources that are used by a source or a destination.

post.description: Creates a new destination.
Searches for destinations.

get.description: Retrieves a destination by its ID.

patch.description: Updates the destination by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a destination by its ID. You can't delete destinations that are referenced in tasks.

post.description: Creates a new source.
Validates a source payload to ensure it can be created and that the data source can be reached by Algolia.
Searches for sources.

get.description: Retrieve a source by its ID.

patch.description: Updates a source by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a source by its ID. You can't delete sources that are referenced in tasks.

post.summary: Validate an update of a source payload
post.description: Validates an update of a source payload to ensure it can be created and that the data source can be reached by Algolia.

Triggers a stream-listing request for a source.
Triggering stream-listing requests only works with sources with `type: docker` and `imageType: airbyte`.

post.summary: Run all tasks linked to a source
post.description: Runs all tasks linked to a source, only available for Shopify, BigCommerce and commercetools sources. Creates one run per task.

taskWithRunID.description: Map of taskID sent for reindex with the corresponding runID.

post.description: Creates a new task.

requestBody.description: Request body for creating a task.

post.description: Searches for tasks.

get.description: Retrieves a task by its ID.

put.description: Fully updates a task by its ID, use partialUpdateTask if you only want to update a subset of fields.

patch.description: Partially updates a task by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a task by its ID.

post.description: Runs a task. You can check the status of task runs with the observability endpoints.

Pushes records through the pipeline, directly to an index. You can make the call synchronous by providing the `watch` parameter, for asynchronous calls, you can use the observability endpoints or the debugger dashboard to see the status of your task.
If you want to transform your data before indexing, this is the recommended way of ingesting your records.
This method is similar to `push`, but requires a `taskID` instead of a `indexName`, which is useful when many `destinations` target the same `indexName`.

get.description: Retrieves a list of tasks using the v1 endpoint, please use `getTasks` instead.

post.description: Creates a new task using the v1 endpoint, please use `createTask` instead.

requestBody.description: Request body for creating a task.

post.description: Searches for tasks using the v1 endpoint, please use `searchTasks` instead.

get.description: Retrieves a task by its ID using the v1 endpoint, please use `getTask` instead.

patch.description: Updates a task by its ID using the v1 endpoint, please use `updateTask` instead.

delete.description: Deletes a task by its ID using the v1 endpoint, please use `deleteTask` instead.

post.description: Runs a task using the v1 endpoint, please use `runTask` instead. You can check the status of task runs with the observability endpoints.

put.description: Enables a task using the v1 endpoint, please use `enableTask` instead.
Disables a task using the v1 endpoint, please use `disableTask` instead.

post.description: Creates a new transformation.

requestBody.description: Request body for creating a transformation.

post.summary: Try a transformation before creating it

Searches for transformations.

get.description: Retrieves a transformation by its ID.

put.description: Updates a transformation by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a transformation by its ID.

get.description: Retrieve a list of task runs.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Date in RFC 3339 format for the earliest run to retrieve. By default, the current day minus seven days is used.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Date in RFC 3339 format for the latest run to retrieve. By default, the current day is used.

get.description: Retrieve a single task run by its ID.
Retrieves a list of events for a task run, identified by its ID.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Date and time in RFC 3339 format for the earliest events to retrieve. By default, the current time minus three hours is used.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Date and time in RFC 3339 format for the latest events to retrieve. By default, the current time is used.

get.description: Retrieves a single task run event by its ID.

get.summary: Switch the API key used to authenticate requests
get.description: Switch the API key used to authenticate requests.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: API key to be used from now on.

get.summary: Replace all records in an index
get.description: Helper: Chunks the given `objects` list in subset of 1000 elements max in order to make it fit in `push` requests by leveraging the Transformation pipeline setup in the Push connector (https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/sending-and-managing-data/send-and-update-your-data/connectors/push).

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: List of objects to replace the current objects with.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The `batch` `action` to perform on the given array of `objects`, defaults to `addObject`.

parameters.name: waitForTasks
parameters.description: Whether or not we should wait until every `batch` tasks has been processed, this operation may slow the total execution time of this method but is more reliable.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: The size of the chunk of `objects`. The number of `batch` calls will be equal to `length(objects) / batchSize`. Defaults to 1000.

apiKey.name: x-algolia-api-key
apiKey.description:
Your Algolia API key with the necessary permissions to make the request.
Permissions are controlled through access control lists (ACL) and access restrictions.
The required ACL to make a request is listed in each endpoint's reference.

action.description:
Which indexing operation to perform:

- `addObject`: adds records to an index.
   Equivalent to the "Add a new record (with auto-generated object ID)" operation.
- `updateObject`: adds or replaces records in an index.
   Equivalent to the "Add or replace a record" operation.
- `partialUpdateObject`: adds or updates attributes within records.
   Equivalent to the "Add or update attributes" operation with the `createIfNoExists` parameter set to true.
   (If a record with the specified `objectID` doesn't exist in the specified index, this action creates adds the record to the index)
- `partialUpdateObjectNoCreate`: same as `partialUpdateObject`, but with `createIfNoExists` set to false.
   (A record isn't added to the index if its `objectID` doesn't exist)
- `deleteObject`: delete records from an index.
  Equivalent to the "Delete a record" operation.
- `delete`. Delete an index. Equivalent to the "Delete an index" operation.
- `clear`: delete all records from an index. Equivalent to the "Delete all records from an index operation".

RunID.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID) of a task run.

EventID.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID) of an event.

Event.description: An event describe a step of the task execution flow.

CreatedAt.description: Date of creation in RFC 3339 format.

data.description:
This field is always null when used with the Push endpoint.
When used for a source discover or source validate run, it will include the sampled data of the source.

events.description: in case of error, observability events will be added to the response.

message.description: a message describing the outcome of the operation that has been ran (push, discover or validate) run.

page.description: Page of the API response to retrieve.

AuthenticationType.description: Type of authentication. This determines the type of credentials required in the `input` object.

oneOf.description:
Name of an ecommerce platform with which to authenticate.
This determines which authentication type you can select.

platformNone.description: Authentication resource not tied to any ecommerce platform, used for filtering.

privateKey.description: Private key of the Google service account. This field is `null` in the API response.

AuthenticationCreate.description: Request body for creating a new authentication resource.

AuthenticationCreateResponse.description: API response for the successful creation of an authentication resource.

DestinationType.description:
Destination type.

- `search`.
  Data is stored in an Algolia index.

- `insights`.
  Data is recorded as user events in the Insights API.

transformationID.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID) of a transformation.

destinationSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the destinations.

destinationID.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID) of a destination resource.

AttributesToExclude.description:
Attributes from your source to exclude from Algolia records.

Not all your data attributes will be useful for searching.
Keeping your Algolia records small increases indexing and search performance.

- Exclude nested attributes with `.` notation. For example, `foo.bar` indexes the `foo` attribute and all its children **except** the `bar` attribute.
- Exclude attributes from arrays with `[i]`, where `i` is the index of the array element.
  For example, `foo.[0].bar` only excludes the `bar` attribute from the first element of the `foo` array, but indexes the complete `foo` attribute for all other elements.
  Use `*` as wildcard: `foo.[*].bar` excludes `bar` from all elements of the `foo` array.

Destination.description: Destinations are Algolia resources like indices or event streams.

DestinationCreate.description: API request body for creating a new destination.

DestinationCreateResponse.description: API response for creating a new destination.

DestinationSearch.description: API request body for searching destinations.

DestinationUpdate.description: API request body for updating a destination.

DestinationUpdateResponse.description: API response for updating a destination.

sourceSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the list of sources.

sourceID.description: Universally uniqud identifier (UUID) of a source.

CommercetoolsCustomFields.description:
Custom fields from commercetools to add to the records.

For more information, see [Using Custom Types and Custom Fields](https://docs.commercetools.com/tutorials/custom-types).

items.description: Unique and immutable key of the referenced store.
Locale specfied as combination of a two-letter language code and an optional two-letter country code.

fallbackIsInStockValue.description: Whether a fallback value is stored in the Algolia record if there's no inventory information about the product.

productQueryPredicate.description: Predicate to filter out specific products when indexing. For more information, see [Query Predicate](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query).

storeHash.description: Store hash identifying your BigCommerce store.

UniqueIDColumn.description: Name of a column that contains a unique ID which will be used as `objectID` in Algolia.

MethodType.description: HTTP method to be used for retrieving your data.

mapping.description: Key-value pairs of column names and their expected types.

delimiter.description: The character used to split the value on each line, default to a comma (\r, \n, 0xFFFD, and space are forbidden).

projectID.description: Project ID of the BigQuery source.

datasetID.description: Dataset ID of the BigQuery source.

table.description: Table name for the BigQuery export.

tablePrefix.description: Table prefix for a Google Analytics 4 data export to BigQuery.

customSQLRequest.description: Custom SQL request to extract data from the BigQuery table.

projectID.description: GCP project ID that the BigQuery export writes to.

datasetID.description: BigQuery dataset ID that the BigQuery export writes to.

tablePrefix.description: Prefix of the tables that the BigQuery Export writes to.

featureFlags.description: Feature flags for the Shopify source.

items.description: Unique and immutable key of the referenced store.
Locale specfied as combination of a two-letter language code and an optional two-letter country code.

fallbackIsInStockValue.description: Whether a fallback value is stored in the Algolia record if there's no inventory information about the product.

productQueryPredicate.description: Predicate to filter out specific products when indexing. For more information, see [Query Predicate](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/predicates/query).

indexToInclude.description: List of index names to include in reindex/update.

indexToExclude.description: List of index names to exclude in reindex/update.

runMetadata.description: Additional information that will be passed to the created runs.

ActionType.description: Action to perform on the Algolia index.

TriggerType.description:
Task trigger, describing when a task should run.

- `onDemand`.
  Manually trigger the task with the `/run` endpoint.

- `schedule`.
  Regularly trigger the task on a `cron` schedule.

- `subscription`.
  Trigger the task after an event is received, such as, a webhook.

- `streaming`.
  Run the task continuously.

taskSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the list of tasks.

taskID.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID) of a task.

Cron.description: Cron expression for the task's schedule.

LastRun.description: The last time the scheduled task ran in RFC 3339 format.

NextRun.description: The next scheduled run of the task in RFC 3339 format.

MappingFieldDirective.description: Describes how a field should be resolved by applying a set of directives.

value.description: How the destination field should be resolved from the source.

MappingKitAction.description: Describes how a destination object should be resolved by means of applying a set of directives.

id.description: ID to uniquely identify this action.

enabled.description: Whether this action has any effect.

trigger.description: Condition which must be satisfied to apply the action. If this evaluates to false, the action is not applied, and the process attempts to apply the next action, if any.

MappingInput.description: Transformations to apply to the source, serialized as a JSON string.

StreamingInput.description: Input for a `streaming` task whose source is of type `ga4BigqueryExport` and for which extracted data is continuously streamed.

DockerStreamsSyncMode.description: The strategy to use to fetch the data.

name.description: The name of the stream to fetch the data from (e.g. table name).

properties.description: The properties of the stream to select (e.g. column).

DockerStreamsInput.description: The selected streams of an airbyte connector.

ShopifyInput.description: Represents the required elements of the task input when using a `shopify` source.

TaskInput.description: Configuration of the task, depending on its type.

failureThreshold.description: Maximum accepted percentage of failures for a task run to finish successfully.

cursor.description: Date of the last cursor in RFC 3339 format.

enabled.description: Whether to send email notifications, note that this doesn't prevent the task from being blocked.

Policies.description: Set of rules for a task.

criticalThreshold.description: The number of critical failures in a row before blocking the task and sending a notification.

TaskCreate.description: API request body for creating a task.

TaskCreateResponse.description: API response for creating a task.

TaskReplace.description: API request body for updating a task.

TaskUpdateResponse.description: API response for updating a task.

TaskUpdate.description: API request body for partially updating a task.

runMetadata.description: Additional information that will be passed to the created run.

RunResponse.description: API response for running a task.

OnDemandTriggerType.description: Task is run manually, with the `/run` endpoint.

SubscriptionTriggerType.description: Task runs after receiving subscribed event.

StreamingTrigger.description: Trigger input for continuously running tasks.

TaskV1.description: The V1 task object, please use methods and types that don't contain the V1 suffix.

TaskCreateV1.description: API request body for creating a task using the V1 shape, please use methods and types that don't contain the V1 suffix.

TaskUpdateV1.description: API request body for updating a task using the V1 shape, please use methods and types that don't contain the V1 suffix.

transformationSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the list of transformations.

TransformationType.description: The type of transformation, which can be either 'code' or 'noCode'.

AuthenticationIDs.description: The authentications associated with the current transformation.

Code.description: It is deprecated. Use the `input` field with proper `type` instead to specify the transformation code.

TransformationCode.description: Input for a transformation that contains the source code of the transformation.

code.description: The source code of the transformation.

TransformationNoCodeStep.description: A step in a no-code transformation.

TransformationNoCode.description: Input for a no-code transformation that contains a series of steps.

TransformationInput.description: The input for the transformation, which can be either code or a no-code configuration.

Name.description: The uniquely identified name of your transformation.

Description.description: A descriptive name for your transformation of what it does.

TransformationCreate.description: API request body for creating a transformation.

TransformationCreateResponse.description: API response for creating a transformation.

sampleRecord.description: The record to apply the given code to.

payloads.description: The array of stringified records returned by the transformation service.

error.title: transformationError
error.description: The error if the transformation failed.

message.description: A descriptive message explaining the failure.

TransformationUpdateResponse.description: API response for updating a transformation.

runSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the list of task runs.

RunReasonCode.description: A code for the task run's outcome. A readable description of the code is included in the `reason` response property.

startedAt.description: Date of start in RFC 3339 format.

finishedAt.description: Date of finish in RFC 3339 format.

reason.description: More information about the task run's outcome.

Window.description: Time window by which to filter the observability data.

startDate.description: Date in RFC 3339 format representing the oldest data in the time window.

endDate.description: Date in RFC 3339 format representing the newest data in the time window.

eventSortKeys.description: Property by which to sort the list of task run events.

FeatureNotEnabled.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

MethodNotAllowed.description: Method not allowed with this API key.
